p: The acetic acid-induced writhing model is commonly used to assess the peripheral anti-nociceptive activity of the drug under investigation [ 33]. Swiss albino mice weighing 25–30 g were divided into 3 groups (6–8 mice) and pretreated with the vehicle (1% Tween 80,10 mL/kg), the extract (200 mg/kg, p.o.), or diclofenac (20 mg/kg) for 1 h, followed by 0.7% acetic acid injection (1 mL/100 g, i.p.). The number of writhes (constriction of abdomen, turning of trunk and extension of hind legs) was recorded for 25 min.
